com.pb.sawdust.tabledata.basic

Class PieceWiseDataTable

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.pb.sawdust.tabledata.basic.WrappedDataTable
      • com.pb.sawdust.tabledata.basic.FixedSizeDataTable
        • com.pb.sawdust.tabledata.basic.PieceWiseDataTable
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DataTable, java.lang.Iterable<DataRow>

    public class PieceWiseDataTable
extends FixedSizeDataTable
    The PieceWiseDataTable class provides a data table which consists of a (non-contiguous) selection of rows from another data table. The selection of rows need not be sequential, nor unique, and the piecewise data table instance will always be a view on the source data table, not a copy of it. That means that changes to the source data table will be reflected through to the piecewise data table, and operations such as adding or removing rows may cause the piecewise data table to change fundamentally (point to different rows) or invalid (point to non-existent rows).

    The PieceWiseDataTable is a fixed-size view on the source data table, so any mutating operations on the table (adding/removing rows or columns) will throw an UnsupportedOperationException.

    • Constructor Detail

      • PieceWiseDataTable

        public PieceWiseDataTable(DataTable sourceTable,
                  int... rows)
        Constructor specifying the source table and the rows from which the piecewise table will be built. The order of the rows in the piecewise table will be the same as in the rows argument passed to this constructor.
        Parameters:
        sourceTable - The source data table.
        rows - The rows, in order, from which the piecewise data table will be formed. At least one row must be specified
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any row in rows is less than zero or greater than or equal to the number of rows in sourceTable, or if rows.length == 0.
